author: Bethan McKernan
title: Elor Azaria: Israeli soldier sentenced to 18 months in jail for shooting dead wounded Palestinian attacker
text:
Watch the opening musical number from Beauty and the Beast An Israel Defence Force (IDF) medic who shot a Palestinian assailant in the head when he was immobilised on the ground last year has been sentenced to a year and a half in prison after being found guilty of manslaughter by a Tel Aviv military court last month. The landmark ruling against the now 20-year-old Sergeant Elor Azaria marked the first time a member of the IDF had been convicted of the charge in 12 years. The prosecution had sought a sentence of between three - five years. Azaria, who was given 18 months jail time and 12 months probation for the Hebron killing of Abdel Fattah al-Sharif on Tuesday, had asked beforehand for the judges to "show mercy" to him and his family. The medic was also demoted to Private. Israeli soldier Elor Azaria is embraced by his mother at the start of is sentencing hearing at a military court in Tel Aviv, Israel on February 21, 2017 (REUTERS) The case has split Israeli society. There have been several fundraisers and protests in support of Azaria, and high profile calls for the young recruit to be given a pardon by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Around 100 supporters waited outside the court, continuing to protest the guilty ruling. His defence team had already said they will appeal the conviction.
